It's gratifying to see my efforts bear fruit here in Venice; my elevation to Popolani is a testament to the Genovese spirit of adaptation, even if some still see me as an outsider. My Artisan's House is now providing a steady stream of ducats, especially with the recent rent adjustment and a new tenant, and my Contract Stall, with young Jun at the helm, holds promise in the bustling Ruga degli Orefici – I must ensure its profitability meets my expectations. While my personal coffers are not overflowing after these significant investments, the income from my properties, coupled with the reliable wages from Italia's enterprise – now thankfully increased – should allow me to rebuild my capital. My primary concern now is to consolidate these gains and manage my relationships carefully, particularly with esteemed landowners like BasstheWhale and the ConsiglioDeiDieci, as my ventures depend on their land. Though land-based trade has proven surprisingly lucrative, a part of me still yearns for the sea, and every ducat earned is a step closer to perhaps, one day, commanding a deck again. For now, vigilance in my current affairs and astute accumulation of wealth shall be my watchwords; this city offers many currents, and a wise captain knows when to trim his sails and when to seek new horizons.
